title: Coinbase-incubated Base experiences stall in block production
content: Coinbase-developed blockchain Base appeared to stall on Tuesday. The Layer 2 quickly deployed a fix and said it had started to see a recovery.

"We are investigating a stall in production of blocks," Base wrote in a status update. "Users may have issues submitting transactions. We are actively investigating and will provide updates as we have them."
Base has since identified the issue and said it is implementing a solution. "We've begun remediating," it wrote in a status update.
"We have deployed a fix and are starting to see recovery of block production and gossip," it added at 6:09 p.m. ET.

The Block Research confirmed around 5:45 p.m. ET that transactions had not been going through. The issue appeared to have been the largest technical glitch the protocol has experienced since its public launch on Aug. 9.
Despite it's short life-span, Base has come to dominate daily new unique addresses for optimistic rollups, The Block's Data Dashboard shows.
